alert.note: Alert for East Bay Interior Valleys; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 12 at 8:42AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is likely. * WHERE...Entire San Francisco Bay Area and Central Coast including Monterey and San Benito Counties. * WHEN...From Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rivers and streams are still running high and or out of their banks at this time. Periods of light rain will continue this weekend through Monday. By Monday night into Tuesday another strong atmospheric river will arrive bringing another round of heavy rain to the region. 3 to 7 inches of rain is forecast for the coastal hills with 1 to 3 inches in the valleys. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Interior Valleys; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio
